*div1 type="summary"* *p*Henry Austin to Austin, August 26, 1831. Insects and heat. Cotton mill*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**location_mentioned*Brazoria */location_mentioned**date_mentioned n="08-26-1831">26 August /31*/date_mentioned**/p* *p*My dear Sir,*/p*
*p*My health is so far restored that I am on my way to the *location_mentioned*mouth of the River*/location_mentioned* for shells for my *location_mentioned*buildings */location_mentioned*and have hopes I have conquered the desease— I have been extremely anxious about you and [your] *person_mentioned*Sister's family*/person_mentioned*, the fever is so prevalent that travelling in such intense heat as we have had is extremly hazardous, to *person_mentioned*persons */person_mentioned*unacclimated and even to you who are so hardy— *person_mentioned*John*/person_mentioned* has brought on fever by riding *location_mentioned*in the sun */location_mentioned*but is nearly recovered— It positively will not do for either myself or *person_mentioned*Mr Perry*/person_mentioned* to think of keeping our *person_mentioned*familys */person_mentioned*in *location_mentioned*this part of the country*/location_mentioned* in the summer months, the insects alone would drive them mad. They have operated upon me at *location_mentioned*Bolivar */location_mentioned*like a perpetual blister. I wish much to accompany you to the *location_mentioned*upper country*/location_mentioned* when you go. I beg you will advise me of your movements— at present I have five *person_mentioned*men*/person_mentioned* under pay till the *date_mentioned n="09-10-1831">10th proxo*/date_mentioned* and as nothing is done unless I am present, I do not wish to leave until then, still should you go sooner I would endeavour to join you.*/p*
*p*I had hopes you would have taken your *person_mentioned*Sisters family*/person_mentioned* to *location_mentioned*Coles Settlement*/location_mentioned* until the heats were over, would it not be best for them to go there now ?—*/p*
*p*Should you come to *location_mentioned*Brazoria */location_mentioned*do me the favor to let me know when, if oppy offers for *location_mentioned*Boliva*/location_mentioned**/p*r
*p*I have a letter from *location_mentioned*Ware */location_mentioned*altho he had no accounts from me he had contracted for Machinery with the intention of working it in *location_mentioned*Louisiana */location_mentioned*in case my report should be unfavorable for *location_mentioned*Texas*/location_mentioned*, the advise of the failure of a*location_mentioned* house in Orleans */location_mentioned*whose paper he held for 10600$ payable *date_mentioned n="06-01-1831">1 June*/date_mentioned* here caused him to suspend the contract until he could ascertain the result of that and his other *location_mentioned*N Orleans */location_mentioned*papers this being part of the sum appropriated to *location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned* Speculations, his letter was obviously written at the moment of receiving the unpleasant news, as he seems to consider all his *location_mentioned*Orleans paper */location_mentioned*in Jeopardy— so much for lending Money at 12 prct—the receipt of my letters and ascertaining the actual extent of loss will probably put him in better spirits*/p*
*p*My best regards to *person_mentioned*Emily */person_mentioned*and Compes to *person_mentioned*Mr Perry*/person_mentioned*—I will indeavour to visit *location_mentioned*St Felepe */location_mentioned*by the *date_mentioned n="09-15-1831">*location_mentioned*middle of Septr*/location_mentioned**/date_mentioned* at all events*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*H Austin */person_mentioned* [Rubric]*/p*
*p*[Addressed:] *person_mentioned*Col S F Austin*/person_mentioned* *location_mentioned*St Felepe*/location_mentioned**/p*
*/div1*
